intro: Phyllanthus rupicola, commonly known as the rock phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often thick and fleshy, which helps in storing water, while its flowers are usually greenish-yellow, lacking petals. Phyllanthus rupicola is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
